definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: This world we live in is the dance of the creator.
sentences.chinese: 我们住的这个世界是场创作者的舞蹈。

sentences.english: The creator and creation merge into wholeness of joy.
sentences.chinese: 创作者与创作融成完整的喜悦。

sentences.english: The second part is on campus DV creator of opera and the works of the analysis.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是对校园DV剧的创作者与作品分析。

sentences.english: A large set of open licenses are available to hardware creators.
sentences.chinese: 现在已经有大量的开放许可可供硬件创作者使用。

sentences.english: There are two lessons in morphogenesis for creators of artificial evolution.
sentences.chinese: 人工进化的创作者可以从形态形成中学到两个经验。

sentences.english: because after it's been created, it's apart from them now.
sentences.chinese: 因为作品创作出来之后，是独立于创作者的。

sentences.english: From it, there was all fortunate and unfortunate of the Chinese localism fiction and its authors.
sentences.chinese: 由此，乡土小说和其创作者的幸与不幸都在这里了。

sentences.english: This website includes many free design resources for the vector artist.
sentences.chinese: 此网站为矢量创作者提供了不少免费资源。

sentences.english: Marble was chosen by the author of the project personally.
sentences.chinese: 大理石是由本项目的创作者亲自挑选的。

definition: to create/to produce/to write/creative work/creation/CL:個|个[ge4]
